title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 5): Feeding Each Other, Freeing Each Other - Free Fridges and Pantries
summary: How to start a Free Fridge or Pantry without Power Over dynamics. A guide to creating public food access points based on trust, dignity, and mutual support with no gatekeeping.

Food.summary: Create direct, no-barrier access to food through community-managed fridges and pantries.

level0: Gather 2-5 people committed to food justice and mutual aid
Identify need and location through neighborhood walking
level1: Choose model (fridge, pantry, or both) based on climate and community needs
Build or acquire materials with neighbor involvement
level2: Establish fridge/pantry with 'take what you need, leave what you can' approach
Create culture of shared care through rotating caretaking
level3: Build network of multiple food access points across community
Support others in starting their own fridges/pantries

Community.summary: Build trust and shared responsibility through collective care infrastructure.

level0: Use consensus decision-making with no formal roles or hierarchy
level1: Practice Power With by refusing policing of what people take
Build relationships face-to-face before using social media
level2: Rotate caretaking duties and encourage anonymous contributions
Partner with mutual aid pods, schools, and clinics
level3: Create decentralized network of community food access
Model trust-based mutual aid for broader community

Knowledge.summary: Learn practical skills for community care while teaching mutual aid principles.

level0: Learn food safety and fridge maintenance basics
Practice shared decision-making and conflict resolution
level1: Develop skills in weatherproofing and basic construction
Learn to facilitate community meetings without hierarchy
level2: Teach others how to start fridges and pantries
level3: Become regional resource for mutual aid food projects
Train facilitators in Power With organizing methods

Narrative.summary: Shift from charity model to solidarity and mutual aid understanding.

level0: Practice messaging around solidarity rather than charity
level1: Help others understand dignity-based food access
Share stories of community care and mutual support
level2: Challenge narratives about deserving vs undeserving people
Promote abundance mindset over scarcity thinking
level3: Transform community understanding of food access as human right
Build culture where mutual aid becomes normalized
